fuzzycontroller.system package#

Modules#

fuzzycontroller.system.singleton#

class fuzzycontroller.system.singleton.SingletonFIS#

Bases: object

A Singleton Inference System.

A singleton inference system calculates firing strengths / degrees of membership using a singleton fuzzy set / a spike for each crisp input.

variables#

dictionary of linguistic variables.

output_variable#

name of the output variable.

rg#

rules of the system.

json_handler#
Class:

.JsonHandler object.

compute_aggregate_set(crisp_inputs) → ndarray[Any, dtype[ScalarType]]#

Computes the aggregate set for the given crisp inputs.

Parameters:

crisp_inputs – dictionary containing the crisp inputs.

Returns:

aggregate set for the given crisp inputs.

compute_defuzzified_output(crisp_inputs, defuzzication_method='centroid')#

Computes the defuzzified output for the given crisp inputs.

Parameters:

  • crisp_inputs – dictionary containing the crisp inputs.

  • defuzzication_method – method used to defuzzify the output default: centroid

Returns:

defuzzified output for the given crisp inputs.

compute_output_sets(crisp_inputs: dict) → dict[str, NDArray]#

Computes the output sets for the given crisp inputs.

There will be one output set for each rule.

Parameters:

crisp_inputs – dictionary containing the crisp inputs.

Returns:

dictionary containing the output sets for each rule.

get_all_firing_strengths(crisp_inputs: dict) → dict[str, dict[str, float]]#

Computes the firing strength of all the linguistic terms from inputs. Inputs should be of the form {‘input1’: 1.0, ‘input2’: 2.0} where the keys are the names of the linguistic variables and the values are the crisp inputs.

Parameters:

crisp_inputs – dictionary containing the crisp inputs.

Returns:

dictionary containing the firing strengths of all the linguistic terms. Will be of the form {‘input1’: {(‘term1’, 0.5), …}, ‘input2’: …}

load_data(input_file: str)#

Loads the data from a json file

Input file should correspond to ‘example.json’ in the root of the repository.

Parameters:

input_file – path to the json file containing the data.
